revised_title: Chemical and Microscopical Examination of Salt Spring Waters and Rocks in Huel Seton Mine
tldr: This article examines the composition and origin of the waters of a salt spring in Huel Seton Mine, Cornwall, and investigates the surrounding rocks. The author suggests that the salt spring may be a result of sea water infiltrating through faults and interacting with the local geology, leading to the formation of various minerals and salts.
